clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicomponent Intervention for Prevention and Treatment of Sleep Disturbances in a Psychiatric Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicomponent Intervention for Prevention and Treatment of Sleep Disturbances in a Psychiatric Intensive Care Unit: A Before-After, Randomized, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Hospitalized adult patients suffer from sleep deprivation, which has been associated with multiple negative consequences, both in short and in the long term. Many factors have been attributed to poor sleep quality, including excessive noise, inappropriate lighting, interactions with the healthcare team, administration of drugs, patients' symptoms, among others. There is scarce evidence reporting multicomponent interventions aimed at ensuring and improving sleep quality in hospitalized patients. The following before-after, randomized controlled trial will evaluate and determine the feasibility, acceptability and effectivity of a multicomponent intervention in improving sleep quality and reducing the consequences of poor sleep in a psychiatric intensive care unit (PICU). The intervention is comprised of changes in health personnel habits, improvements in the PICU environment, patient's psychoeducation and continuous sleep and activity monitoring through a validated wearable device.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Before-after design for the implementation of unit-wide intervention, with a later randomization for individualized interventions.
study_design_info.masking_description: Two investigators will work on-site collecting data for each of the variables, uploading them to a secure database (REDCap) as anonymous data. Afterwards, data and outcomes will be analyzed by a blinded investigator.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
primary_outcome.description: Measured in hours and minutes, using objective data obtained via Fitbit Charge 4 devices, and subjective data obtained directly from the patient using the Sleep Diary, a consensus tool for the self report of different standardized sleep variables.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Number and Total Duration of Nocturnal Awakenings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in integer numbers for mean number and minutes for duration, using subjective data obtained directly from the patient using the Sleep Diary, and objective data obtained via Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Number and Total Duration of Naps During the Day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in integer numbers for mean number and minutes for duration, using subjective data obtained directly from the patient using the Sleep Diary, and objective data obtained via Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Average Time of Falling Sleep and Awakening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in time of day in 24-hour notation, using subjective data obtained directly from the patient using the Sleep Diary, and objective data obtained via Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Architecture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in minutes of total duration for each sleep phase (awake, light sleep, deep sleep and REM) and as a relative value of the total sleep time, using objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Onset Latency Mean Duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in minutes of total time spent awake from the time of going to bed with the intention of falling asleep to the time of the first registered sleep phase, using subjective data from the Sleep Diary and objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in REM Onset Latency Mean Duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in minutes of total time spent awake from the time of going to bed with the intention of falling asleep to the time of the first registered REM phase, using subjective data from the Sleep Diary and objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Wake After Sleep Onset Mean Duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in minutes of total time spent awake from the time of the first registered sleep phase to the time of the last registered awakening, using objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Efficiency
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in percentage of total time spent sleeping at night, calculated as total sleep time divided by total time spent in bed, using subjective data from the Sleep Diary and objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in integer numbers, using objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices, considering the heart rate during the day and while in bed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Number of Steps
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in integer numbers, using objective data measured by Fitbit Charge 4 devices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Level of Sound
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in decibels, using objective data registered by a decibel meter placed in the participant's rooms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Level of Light
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in lux, using objective data registered by a lux meter placed in the participant's rooms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Sleep Quality Perception
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the Richard Campbell Sleep Questionnaire (RCSQ), which considers 5 domains in Likert scales, and registers a mean score of all domains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Daytime Sleepiness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS), which considers 8 hypothetical situations and scores the likelihood of falling asleep from 0 to 3, and registers a total aggregated score (with a maximum total score of 24).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Subjective Perception of Sleep-Disturbing Factors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using complementary questions regarding the presence/absence of factors (either environmental, symptomatological, or other) and their identification using predefined options: excessive light, excessive noise, interactions with health personnel, pain, anxiety, or others. In case of selecting "others", a text field will be available for its description.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Pharmacological Indications and Need of SOS Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Registered using extensive charts of common use medications during hospitalization, obtaining data registered in the participant's daily medical chart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in millimetres of mercury (mmHg), using morning data registered in the participant's daily medical chart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge. To be measured from the second branch onward, after the environmental interventions implementation.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a Visual Analog Scale for Pain (scores ranging from 0 - 10 points), using data registered at 20:00 PM, in the participant's daily medical chart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of Anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment, during the first 72 hours of hospitalization, for up to 14 days or discharge. To be measured from the second branch onward, after the environmental interventions implementation.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a Visual Analog Scale for Anxiety (scores ranging from 0 - 10 points), using data registered at 20:00 PM, in the participant's daily medical chart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Length of Stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day 1 of hospitalization until discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in days, using data from the participant's medical record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 30-day Readmission Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after the participant's discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as a proportion, using data from the participant's medical record and telephonic follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Participant Satisfaction Regarding Sleep During Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after the participant's discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the subjective experience of the participant, using telephone surveys.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Satisfaction Regarding the Intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after the participant's discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the subjective experience of participants, using telephone surveys.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Personnel Satisfaction and Agreeability Regarding the Intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months through study completion, an average of 1.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the subjective experience of treating physicians and nursery team, using web-based surveys.

intervention.description: The nursery staff will be instructed to promote sleep hygiene. Nurse technicians will: inform patients of the efforts to ensure a healthy sleep environment, verify the minimization of light and noise after 23:00 PM, favour natural light after 07:00 AM, and foment patient's activities and participation in group therapy. Nurses will: reduce sleep interruptions to a minimum, to only perform actions (i.e. blood testing, clinical controls, medicine administration) deemed strictly necessary between 23:00 PM and 07:00 AM. A list of commonly used medications with their pharmacodynamic and pharmacokinetic properties tailored by a pharmaceutical chemist will be provided, to ensure optimal medication administration while protecting the guaranteed sleep hours, to be coordinated with the treating physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalized in the last 72 hours.
- Capacity to consent
- Approval by treating physician
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active psychosis
- Active eating disorder
- Delirium
- Major cognitive disorder
